FirstSection.title: Data engineering course with industry experience
FirstSection.desc: Learn the principles of data engineering by enrolling in the best data engineering course. Gain valuable experience working on top-tier industry-collaborated projects as well.

BoxShape.title: Why Join this Programme?
BoxShape.box1desc: You get the opportunity to bring your own projects and receive the assistance to complete them. Besides, get project certification from well-known startups.
BoxShape.box2desc: Most importantly, you will be able to self-design your courses. In addition, you can get expert level data engineering training by experts.
BoxShape.box3desc: To begin, you can assure yourself a job with 100% job guarantee. In addition, you can get free career counseling services and guidance.
BoxShape.box4desc: This program is recommended for professionals with at least 1 year of work experience. No prior programming experience is required

syllabusDesc: Data Engineering course curated by leading faculties and industry leaders to provide pratical learning experience with live interactive classes and projects.

Module0.title: Module 0 Introduction
Module0.desc: The Foundations block comprises of two courses where we get our hands dirty with Statistics and Code, head-on. These two courses set our foundations so that we sail through the rest of the journey with minimal hindrance.

chap.title: Chapter 1: Introduction to Programming ( 3 hrs )
desc: Source code Vs bytecode Vs machine code, Compiler Vs Interpreter, C/C++, Java Vs Python.

chap.title: Chapter 2: code editors basics (1 hrs)
desc: Different type of code editors in python, Introduction to Anaconda and IDEs

chap.title: Chapter 3: python basics (1 hrs)
desc: Variable Vs Identifiers, Strings Operators Vs Operand, Procedure oriented Vs Modular programming.

chap.title: Chapter 4: statistics basics & probability (1 hrs)
desc: Measures of Central Tendency & dispersion, Inferential statistics and Sampling theory.

chap.title: Chapter 2: PYTHON INTRODUCTION (1 hrs)
desc: How a Python Program runs on our system?
Features of Python Memory Management in Python,

chap.title: Chapter 6: EXPECTION HANDELING
desc: Nestedtry-except block & Default except for block.

chap.title: Chapter 7: MODULES IN PYTHON
desc: Importing Modules and different import statement

chap.title: Chapter 8: FILE HANDELING
desc: Why do we need File Handling?

chap.title: Chapter 10: NUMPY IN PYTHON
desc: Intro & use of numpy, What is an array?

chap.title: Chapter 11: PANDAS IN PYTHON
desc: Exporting Dataframe to CSV and Excel

chap.title: Chapter 13: Seaborn
desc: Working with seaborn on titanic dataset

chap.title: Chapter 1:- Probability theory and Statistical Inferences ( 4 hrs )
desc: Discrete Probability Distributions - Binomial, Poisson etc
Continuous Probability Distributions - Gaussian, Normal, etc

chap.title: Chapter 2: Statistics Foundations (1 hrs)
desc: Measures of Central tendency and Dispersion
Sampling theory and scales of measurement

chap.title: Chapter 3: Hypothesis Testing and its Applications (1 hrs)
desc: Basic Concepts - Formulation of Hypothesis, Making a decision
Advanced Concepts - Choice of Test - t test vs z test
Evaluation of Test - P value and Critical Value approach

chap.title: Chapter 4: Exploratory Data Analysis and the Art of Storytelling (1 hrs)
Chapter 5: Exploratory Analysis on Credit Card data
Chapter 1:A primer on Machine Learning ( 3 hrs )
desc: Types of Learning - Supervised, Unsupervised and Reinforcement
Types of Analysis - Descriptive, Predictive, and Prescriptive
Bias Variance Tradeoff - Overfitting vs Underfitting

chap.title: Chapter 2: Regression - Linear Regression
desc: What is linear in Linear Regression?
Model Evaluation Metrics for regression problems - MAE, RMSE, MSE, and MAP

chap.title: Chapter 3: Classification - Logistic Regression
desc: Up sampling, Down sampling and SMOTE
One vs Rest (OVR) for multinomial classification
Model Evaluation Metrics for classification - Confusion matrix
Misclassification error, Precision, Recall, F1 score, and AUC-ROC
Choosing the best error metric for a problem

chap.title: Chapter 4: Clustering-K means
desc: K Means Algorithms - Partition based model for clustering

chap.title: Chapter 5: KNN
desc: Non-Parametric algorithms and Lazy learning ideology
Applications in Missing value imputes and Balancing datasets

chap.title: Chapter 7: Decision Trees
desc: Why are they called Greedy Algorithms?

chap.title: Chapter 8: Ensemble Techniques
desc: Introduction to Bagging as an Ensemble technique
Bootstrap Aggregation and Out of Bag error
Random Forests and its Applications in Feature selection
How Bagging overcomes the overfitting problem?
How Boosting overcomes the Bias - Variance Tradeoff
Gradient Boosting and Xgboost as regularised boosting

chap.title: Chapter 11: Time-series Analysis
desc: The Random Walk model and Stationarity of Time Series
Tests for Stationarity - ADF and Dickey- Fuller test, AR, MA, ARIMA, SARIMA models
A regression approach to time series forecasting.

chap.title: Chapter 12: How to Build and Deploy a Machine Learning Pipeline
desc: Principal Component Analysis for Dimensionality reduction
Feature Selection Techniques - Forward and Backward elimination, RFE
Serving the model via Rest API

chap.title: Chapter 1: Introduction to Data Modelling
desc: Understand the purpose of data modeling
Identify the strengths and weaknesses of different types of databases and data storage techniques
Create a table in Postgres and Apache Cassandra

chap.title: Chapter 2: Rational Data Models
desc: Understand when to use a relational database
Understand the difference between OLAP and OLTP databases

chap.title: Chapter 3: No SQL Data Models
desc: Understand when to use NoSQL databases and how they differ from relational databases
Select the appropriate primary key and clustering columns for a given use case
Create a NoSQL database in Apache Cassandran

chap.title: Chapter 4: statistics basics & probability (1 hrs)
desc: Measures of Central Tendency & dispersion, Inferential statistics and Sampling theory.

Module0.title: Module 5 - Data Warehousing on the Cloud

chap.title: Chapter 1: Introduction to Data Warehouses
desc: Run an ETL process to denormalize a database (3NF to Star)
Create an OLAP cube from facts and dimensions
Compare columnar vs. row oriented approaches

chap.title: Chapter 2: Introduction to the Cloud with AWS
desc: Create an AWS account and understand their services
Set up Amazon S3, IAM, VPC, EC2, RDS PostgreSQL

chap.title: Chapter 3: Understand cloud computing 2. Create an AWS account and understand their services 3. Set up Amazon S3, IAM, VPC, EC2, RDS PostgreSQL
desc: Identify components of the Redshift architecture
Run ETL process to extract data from S3 into Redshift
Set up AWS infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (IaC)

chap.title: Chapter 1: The Power of Spark
desc: Understand when to use Spark and when not to use it

chap.title: Chapter 2:Data Wrangling with Spark
desc: Manipulate data with SparkSQL and Spark Dataframes

chap.title: Chapter 3: Debugging and Optimization
desc: Troubleshoot common errors and optimize their code using the Spark WebUI

chap.title: Chapter 4: Introduction to Data Lakes
desc: Understand the purpose and evolution of data lakes
Implement data lakes on Amazon S3, EMR, Athena, and Amazon Glue
Use Spark to run ELT processes and analytics on data of diverse sources, structures, and vintages
Understand the components and issues of data lakes

Module0.title: Module 7 - Automating Data Pipelines with Airflow

chap.title: Chapter 1: Data Pipelines
desc: Create data pipelines with Apache Airflow

chap.title: Chapter 2:Data Quality
desc: Write tests to ensure data quality

chap.title: Chapter 3: Production Data Pipelines
desc: Build your own Apache Airflow plugins

chap.title: Chapter 1: Advance SQL
desc: CEIL & FLOOR, POWER, RANDOM, ROUND, SETSEED.

chap.title: Chapter 2: Introduction to Tableau
desc: Different charts on TABLEAU (Bar graphs, Line graphs, Scatter graphs, Crosstabs, Histogram, Heatmap, Tree maps, Bullet graphs, etc.)

chap.title: Chapter 3: - Data Types in TABLEAU.
desc: Adding a second layer moving average.

chap.title: Chapter 4: - Data Types in TABLEAU.
desc: Filters and Slicers in Power BI.

BatchDetails.BatchHeader: The Data engineering course next cohorts 2022

FAQ.desc: Read the FAQ’s below to know more about our data engineering training, fees and project details.

FaqDATA.ques: What is data engineering course duration and what modules are covered?
FaqDATA.ans: The data engineering course lasts for six months. The amount of time you spend learning will vary depending on your schedule (weekdays/weekends). Also, you will be able to study a variety of topics under different courses. Especially, starting with the principles of programming, such as python and cloud basics, and progressing to advanced Excel, DBMS - SQL and NoSQL, and concepts like ETL and python with object-oriented programming.

FaqDATA.ques: What are the prerequisites for enrolling in a data engineering course?
FaqDATA.ans: We believe that any eager data science aspirant can make a successful data science career move. No, we don't have any severe prerequisites for eligibility. But, we do, however, examine candidates' ability for the data engineering course. Particularly, on the basis of programming abilities. The data engineering course has been designed with experts in mind. Besides, a candidate enrolling must have at least one year of professional experience in any field.

FaqDATA.ques: What is the data engineering course fee at Skillslash?
FaqDATA.ans: The data engineering training has a course fee starts from INR 59,000. In addition, you can also avail a scholarship program under our data engineering training. You can get up to a 10% scholarship for the Fresh Graduates program if you take an aptitude exam. So, if a candidate has a score of more than 65 percent on the aptitude exam, he or she will be eligible for a 10 percent reduction on the course fees.

FaqDATA.ques: If I have to miss a class due to an emergency, will there be a make-up class available?
FaqDATA.ans: Above all, we provide live online classes. Additionally, all of our students have access to video recordings of those classes. Besides, we provide you with unrestricted access to these recorded sessions so that you can refer to them whenever you need theoretical assistance in your data engineering, AI or ML career. As a result, if you miss any of the live classes, you won't be disappointed. That said, we do, however, strongly encourage you to attend all live classes.

FaqDATA.ques: What kind of certification does the data engineering course provide?
FaqDATA.ans: The catch is that you will not receive any form of certification or academic degree if you attend the data engineering course. Instead, we provide a project management certificate that is recognized all over the world. Besides, direct certifications are also available from the company with which you completed your industrial project.

FaqDATA.ques: How many projects are included in this data engineering course?
FaqDATA.ans: The data engineering course offers 15+ real-world projects from which you can choose a couple for case study learning based on the demands of your domain. Aside from that, during the following modules, you will have the opportunity to work on three industry projects (capstone projects) with a variety of MNCs and startups.
